div.head: Keywords
div.p: Keywords can be used in priniple for all record types. You can use one or more of the values provided for key. You can assign as many keywords as needed. The keywords "ChristianLiterature", "IslamicLiterature" and "BetaEsraelLiterature" should be assigned to all records belonging to these traditions.
It is very useful and important that at least one Period Keyword is assigned to each Work and Manuscript record.
Each of these is linked to a stable URI provided by Perio.do.
In the following table they are summarized although they are available in the contextual menu via the schema.

div.head: Keywords in manuscript records
div.p: This means that it is not necessary to limit the keywords to the principal text, but keywords for any additional or minor texts contained in the manuscript should also be assigned.

div.head: Keywords in work records
div.p: Always assign a period keyword, using the keywords referring to Ethiopian literary periods only in records actually belonging to the Ethiopian tradition.

div.head: Keywords in other parts of the files
div.p: You can use term also in other parts of the files where the schema allows it. In the following example term is used in a decoNote but you can use it also in additions

decoNote.desc: The runs between and is placed under brightly coloured arches that rest on curtained columns. Several birds are palced atop the arch. The opening page, features a pair of ጣዎስ፡ flanking a cross and four ዱራ፡ birds. The following pages feature the ጠይራት፡ birds on arches decorated with patterns.

div.head: Taxonomy and creating new keywords
div.p: The values available for key have to be included in the taxonomy.
New keywords can be created as needed, but especially when they concern many files or introduce a new way of use should be discussed in an issue.
